content: Hey @Bret H - In our meeting today, it was mentioned you worked on the queries page in the IG to bring them up to date? Can you share an update? http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/genomics-reporting/usecases.html

There was a meeting today!? Drat. I assumed it was canceled due to the WG GM having occurred last week.
I have a branch as you noted and have not pushed my changes to it. Patrick has agreed to review them before merging. Thanks for the question.
Thanks @Bret H - I sent an email to the list yesterday about meeting today. If you have a branch, I would say feel free to push it up and we can get others to review.
(oh, and mentioned on Zulip about the meeting as well ;)) https://chat.fhir.org/#narrow/stream/179304-genomics.2Fcommitters/topic/Call.20Tuesday.20Sep.2024.3F
well it is on me that I missed the call this morning. Can't reverse time. I was very happy to see that Nephi's request was addressed (other chat). Was there anything else I missed?
I emailed the notes to the list serv, feel free to review.
regards queries @James Jones @Patrick Werner @Kevin Power I'm on it. Will push tonight or tomorrow morning and make merge request for review.
@James Jones @Patrick Werner @Kevin Power I'm ready to merge. building locally. cleaning up some markup.
Thanks Bret - Feel free to merge anytime.
great. build is fine, as it should be I'm only messing with a html file. but I'm getting some odd markup bleeding. I'll give up in 15 min.
@James Jones or @Patrick Werner please review my merge and the queries. I checked out what I could with HSPC. The syntax should be good but in some cases I did not check with the specimen parameter.

I didn't do a deep review, but a quick look shows that you have some blue text in a few areas. Did you mean to switch colors? See this section: http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/genomics-reporting/branches/BretOperationsExampleXMLpage/usecases.html#get-all-observed-variants-for-a-specific-patient
Looks like a missed a/> tag, should be an easy fix
Yes there is a problem with the file i'm currently reviewing the changes

realizing something strange happened to the tracker for this: https://gforge.hl7.org/gf/project/fhir/tracker/?action=TrackerItemEdit&tracker_item_id=15884&start=0 it is currently marked as uncompatible and triaged but we voted to update guidance.
adding to Monday's agenda to get input on recent updates

Tracker 15884 should be in "Resolved - Change Required" - Looks like when @ Bob Milius documented the vote details, he didn't update the status and remove the Group field value. We have some guidance here: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/CGW/Tracker+voting+checklist
Luckily we were working on it anyways! Should be able to resolve next week once it gets merged
Jira can't come fast enough :slight_smile:
sorry about that @Kevin Power I'll try to follow the procedure better in the future :dizzy:
<Kevin frantically looking for trackers he didn't update correctly>
@Patrick Werner let me know when the branch can be merged.
@Bret H github didn't persisted my first review .. :unamused: did it again
currently looking at the link issue...
fixed the anchor tags, added code review with some comments.
Pushing latest. I'm not having good luck with the links appearing in a table of contents. Where are the templates for the IGs?
@Patrick Werner https://github.com/HL7/genomics-reporting/pull/2/commits/8c1925296945d68ad64b588f7fca5bb6ddcb44f9 this is the latest committ
Hey @Bret H - I would not worry about the links / TOC. Not sure something like that is built into the template/IG we are using today.
Sounds good to me. The latest commit should be part of the merge request. @Patrick Werner let me know if the additional textual guidance is sufficient.
